title: How to Make Iced Tea Using a Microwave

steps.headline: Get the right tea bags.
steps.description: Depending on the desired strength of your tea, use four family sized bags or 8 to 12 regular-sized bags of Lipton or Luzianne.

steps.headline: Take the teabags out of their paper wrappings and set it on the side.
Fill a four cup sized microwaveable bowl or container with water.
steps.description: Take the tea bags and put them into the water. Cover with a lid or small plate and place it in the microwave.

steps.headline: Place the heat on high for about 4 minutes, depending on the microwave watts.
steps.description: It should let your tea bubble and steam to freshness.

steps.headline: Let the tea stand in the microwave for about 3 minutes.
Take the tea out of the microwave and hold back the tea bags while pouring the tea liquid into a gallon container.
steps.description: Repeat this process by filling the 4 cup container with the teabags up with water, holding the tea bags back, and pouring the water into the gallon pitcher, until the pitcher is full.

steps.headline: Add sweetener (1 1/2 tablespoons of "Sweet N Low" will sweeten a gallon of tea) or sugar (about 2 cups) and pour over ice.

text: Get the right tea bags. Depending on the desired strength of your tea, use four family sized bags or 8 to 12 regular-sized bags of Lipton or Luzianne. Take the teabags out of their paper wrappings and set it on the side.  Fill a four cup sized microwaveable bowl or container with water. Take the tea bags and put them into the water. Cover with a lid or small plate and place it in the microwave. Place the heat on high for about 4 minutes, depending on the microwave watts. It should let your tea bubble and steam to freshness. Let the tea stand in the microwave for about 3 minutes. This allows it to steep. Take the tea out of the microwave and hold back the tea bags while pouring the tea liquid into a gallon container. Repeat this process by filling the 4 cup container with the teabags up with water, holding the tea bags back, and pouring the water into the gallon pitcher, until the pitcher is full. Add sweetener (1 1/2 tablespoons of "Sweet N Low" will sweeten a gallon of tea) or sugar (about 2 cups) and pour over ice. Enjoy! Finished.
